notes: First-generation Legacy midsize sedan and wagon. Available with front-wheel or all-wheel drive. Turbocharged variants available. Established Subaru's reputation for reliable AWD systems. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Legacy article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Second-generation Legacy with improved styling and performance. Available with FWD or AWD. Legacy GT turbocharged variant available. 2.5L engine introduced late in generation. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Legacy article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation Outback introduced as Legacy trim level in 1995, became standalone model. Wagon body style with increased ground clearance and cladding. All-wheel drive standard. Helped establish crossover wagon segment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Outback article, December 19, 2024 revision.

engines: 2.0L EJ20 turbo boxer H4 (240 hp WRX)
notes: First-generation Impreza compact car. Available in multiple body styles including coupe, sedan, wagon, and hatchback. Available with FWD or AWD. WRX turbocharged performance variant introduced in some markets (not U.S. until 2002). Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Impreza article, December 19, 2024 revision.

First-generation Forester compact SUV based on Impreza platform. All-wheel drive standard. Higher seating position and increased cargo space compared to Impreza wagon. Helped establish compact crossover segment. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Forester article, December 19, 2024 revision.

Sports coupe with unique window-within-a-window design by Giugiaro. Flat-six engine. Available with FWD or AWD. Automatic transmission only. Limited production and sales. Difficulty modifier reflects specialized six-cylinder engine maintenance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Subaru Alcyone SVX article, December 19, 2024 revision.
